result.execSummary:
All charges against Kevin M. Barstad in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin M. Barstad is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M. Barstad

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM Defendant Kevin M. Barstad in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Kevin M. Barstad.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

21CF336, 22CF123

Atty Rivard - matters are resolved - plea to Ct 1 in 21CF336 - 22CF123 to be dismissed - 18 months probation, absolute sobriety, AODA and follow through, domestic violence programming, comply with recommendations of agent, $538 + $10, DNA

Court - reads charge and max penalties
Defendant - enters a no contest plea to 21CF336 , waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts no contest plea to 21CF336 and finds defendant guilty 

State - asks Court to follow joint recommendation
Atty Rivard - also asks Court to follow recommendation
Deft - makes statement to the Court

Court - withheld sentence, 18 months probation
  - Absolute sobriety
  - Not to be in the presence or in the possession of drug paraphernalia
  - AODA and follow through
  - Domestic violence programming
  - Comply with recommendations of agent
  - Court costs of $538 + $10 drug surcharge
  - Submit a DNA sample

Dismissed: 22CF123

8:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin M. Barstad in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Kevin M. Barstad. A. Standaert - Clerk 

Atty Rivard - rec'd offer for a global resolution, deft will waive PH
Deft - waives preliminary hearing
Court - accepts waiver and binds deft over for trial - schedules ARGN
Arraignment scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin M. Barstad appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn County Jail. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears by Zoom. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - asking for $500 sign bond - not to possess or be in the presence of controlled substances, no abusive contact with TMB 2/11/1993
Atty Lundeen - no objection
Court - orders $500 sign bond - not to possess or be in the presence of controlled substances, no abusive contact with TMB 2/11/1993, not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores

INIT
